subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
A conflation of two roots: â€œto take; to holdâ€ and â€œwill; be going to; nearâ€.

; â€œto take; to holdâ€ (Pronunciations 1, 2 and 3)
: Sino-Tibetan: compare {{cog|bo|à½ à½†à½„||to hold, to keep, to carry}}.

; â€œwill; be going to; nearâ€ (Pronunciation 1)
: Austroasiatic: compare {{cog|km|á…á„áŸ‹||to want, to wish; to approach, to draw near; about to (do something), on the point of}} < {{cog|mkh-okm|caá¹…a||to wish, to want}}. Cognate with {{och-l|ä¸”|about to; on the point of; moreover; also}} ({{zh-ref|Wu, 2015}}).
